page.title: 19SELSEY COASTGUARD
page.content: The Coastguard in Selsey has been there for 13 years and the Coastguard Station was built in 1972.On average it has 25 calls in a year.The Coastguard Tower has 50 steps and it is approximately 42 metres to the very top.The Coastguard patrols the beach especially in the busy summer months. Amongst his equipment is included radios,binoculars,ropes,flare guns,telephones,first aid boxes and survival food packs.In 1985 there were 14 regular Coastguards based in West Sussex. In 1983, the Coastguard Station at Selsey received 21 calls.In 1984 it received 29 calls and in 1985 _ between January and July _ 12 calls. It is good to know we can rely on the Coastguard for all kinds of help and support.
